remarks:
Define unordered pair of classes.  Definition 7.1 of [Quine] p. 48.  For example, ` A e. { 1 , -u 1 } -> ( A ^ 2 ) = 1 ` ( ~ ex-pr ).  They are unordered, so ` { A , B } = { B , A } ` as proven by ~ prcom .  For a more traditional definition, but requiring a dummy variable, see ~ dfpr2 . (Contributed by NM, 21-Jun-1993.) 

---

 Define unordered pair of classes.  Definition 7.1 of [Quine] p. 48.  They are unordered, so ` { A , B } = { B , A } ` as proven by ~ prcom .  For a more traditional definition, but requiring a dummy variable, see ~ dfpr2 .  (Contributed by NM, 5-Aug-1993.)
